TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit DependentPlatformMissingException extends System.Deployment.Application.DeploymentException

Docs.summary: The exception that is thrown when the platform dependency is not found during activation of the ClickOnce deployment and the deployment will not run.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This exception is thrown when there is a mismatch between the platform requested in the deployment manifest and the platform that ClickOnce is trying to run the application on. In this context, "platform" can refer to the operating system, the installed versions of the common language runtime, or a previously installed assembly. For example, if the ClickOnce application asserts that it requires Windows XP and the user is trying to run the application on Windows 2000, this exception will occur.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error, such as "DefaultMessageDisplayedByParameterlessCtorWriterMustSupply". This message takes into account the current system culture.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.InsufficientMemoryException>.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|`null`.| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The localized error message string.|

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message) cil managed

Docs.param: The message that describes the exception. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified message that describes the error.

|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|`null`.| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The error message string specified in `message`.|

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message, class System.Exception innerException) cil managed
Public Sub New (message As String, innerException As Exception)

Docs.param: The message that describes the exception. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the parameter is not , the current exception is raised in a block that handles the inner exception.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property. The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is passed to the constructor, or `null` if the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Deployment.Application.DependentPlatformMissingException>.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|`null`.| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The error message string specified in `message`.|
